definition: noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke

sentences.english: I set my countdown timer alarm for 30 minutes right when I lie down.
sentences.chinese: 每次我按下30分鐘倒數計時器鬧鈴，然後就躺下。

sentences.english: The gap between alarm and caffeine rarely stretches much beyond 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 鬧鈴和咖啡因之間的間隔時間，很少超過10分鐘。

sentences.english: Headphones with built-in alarm will wake you up in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 帶嵌入式鬧鈴的耳機早上會喚醒你。
聽見可怕的第一聲鬧鈴。

sentences.english: This is your morning wake-up call.
You must answer multiple choice questions to deactivate the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 你必須回答多項選擇題才能關停鬧鈴。

sentences.english: Midway into writing my book, my wake-up call was my cholesterol check.
sentences.chinese: 在我寫作中途，我的鬧鈴是我的膽固醇檢查結果。

sentences.english: You have to grab the gun and shoot the target to turn off the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 你需要抓起槍並射中目標來關掉鬧鈴。

sentences.english: Alternatively, most in-room televisions also double up as an alarm clock.
sentences.chinese: 另外，大部分的房間電視，也應該設有鬧鈴功能。

sentences.english: I heard the alarm clock bleeping this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今早我聽見鬧鈴發出嘟嘟聲。

sentences.english: Alarm options are simple to set up and what you’d expect.
sentences.chinese: 鬧鈴選項設置簡單並如你所願。

sentences.english: Their cell phone alarms rang at six the next morning.
sentences.chinese: 手機鬧鈴在翌日早上六點響起了。

sentences.english: Set a timer for 30 minutes, and work for 30 minutes straight.
sentences.chinese: 設置三十分鐘的鬧鈴，30分鐘內悶頭工作。

sentences.english: Last night I set the alarm for six o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上我把鬧鈴調到了六點鐘。

definition: to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
variant of 雙節棍|双节棍[shuang1 jie2 gun4]
